title: TREASURIES-U.S. yields rise more as Wall Street opens higher
text:
May 14, 2018 / 1:47 PM / Updated 19 minutes ago TREASURIES-U.S. yields rise more as Wall Street opens higher Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
NEW YORK, May 14 (Reuters) - U.S. Treasury yields rose on Monday and then rose more as Wall Street stock prices opened higher, reducing safe-haven bids for low-yielding government debt.
At 9:37 a.m. (1337 GTM), the yield on 10-year Treasury notes was up 2 basis points at 2.990 percent, while the two-year yield was over 1 basis point higher at 2.552 percent. (Reporting by Richard Leong; Editing by David Gregorio)
